subject: Entrepreneurship
title: The Winklevoss Twins vs. Zuckerberg: The Idea War
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Winklevoss Twins vs. Zuckerberg: The Idea War.

hook.text: Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss hired Zuckerberg to build their social network. He built his own instead.

buildup.text: The twins had the concept for HarvardConnection. Zuckerberg delayed their project while coding Facebook.

discovery.text: By the time the twins realized what happened, Facebook had thousands of users and venture capital.

twist.text: They sued and settled for $65M in Facebook stock. They invested it all in Bitcoin and became billionaires.

climax.text: The lawsuit reshaped startup law forever. Courts now take idea-theft claims far more seriously.

punchline.text: Hiring the wrong person can create your biggest competitor.

quiz.question: What did the Winklevoss twins do with their $65M Facebook settlement?
options: They started a competing social network that eventually failed
They invested it all in Bitcoin and became billionaires
They donated it to Harvard's computer science program
